item.title: Rachel add a quote by Rudyard Kipling
item.description: "Words are, of course, the most powerful drug used by mankind." -- Rudyard Kipling

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "We write to taste life twice, in the moment and in retrospect." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Each friend represents a world in us, a world possibly not born until they arrive, and it is only by this meeting that a new world is born." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Zora Neale Hurston
item.description: "There are years that ask questions and years that answer." -- Zora Neale Hurston

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Robert Penn Warren
item.description: "The end of man is knowledge, but there is one thing he can't know. He can't know whether knowledge will save him or kill him. He will be killed, all right, but he can't know whether he is killed because of the knowledge which he has got or because of the knowledge which he hasn't got and which if he had it, would save him." -- Robert Penn Warren

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Robert J. Sawyer
item.description: "Learning to ignore things is one of the great paths to inner peace." -- Robert J. Sawyer

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J. Krishnamurti
item.description: "It is no measure of health to be well adjusted to a profoundly sick society." -- J. Krishnamurti

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "There is only one good, knowledge, and one evil, ignorance." -- Socrates

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "Be slow to fall into friendship, but when you are in, continue firm and constant." -- Socrates

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "The secret of happiness, you see, is not found in seeking more, but in developing the capacity to enjoy less." -- Socrates

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "We cannot live better than in seeking to become better." -- Socrates
